txt.en: 'Victory!'
'Thanks to you, the secret of the Heart of Fire will not be stolen by goblins.'
Are you ready to return and tell the dwarves of my company of our discovery?'
'Folok guessed that foolish outsiders would lead him to the secret room!'
'Attack!'
'Must I do everything myself? Die!'
'Goblins!'
'How incredible that this place should lie forgotten for so long!'
'Behold: the mighty forges of Nâr-khelab!'
'Quickly, my friend: search the three forges for sign of Zigilburk, the mithril axe!'
'Will you look at that? We were right after all, [placeholder]!'
'Yes, boss!'
'I will now say the opening words...'
'Right away!'
'Bâb kanon zuhûk!'
'We have done it! We have found Nâr-khelab, the Heart of Fire!'
'Stay alert, [placeholder]. There may be more of them.'

'If the Heart of Fire actually exists, I believe it must be behind this wall.

'What were the secret means of opening it that you recovered from Katûb-zahar, [placeholder]? Ah, yes! The great blacksmith Ongli desired not to be disturbed, not even by Durin himself, unless by ceremonial gestures of acknowledgement worthy of his station.

'You should <rgb=#FF0000>hail</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>congratulate</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>salute</rgb> him, [placeholder]. I hope that we have read the clues aright!'

'Thank you for your help with the goblins, and with the gredbyg before them!\n\n'Let us now return to the Chamber of the Cross-roads to tell of our victory, and that the Heart of Fire has been unsealed!'

'I hope this adventure will not be in vain. To find the legendary forges of Nâr-khelab would work wonders on the hopes and efforts of my people. The chance that the mithril axe Zigilburk might lie within... I cannot describe what a boon that would be.\n\n'Let us proceed, my friend. We are nearing the wall that might very well be hiding the door we seek.'

'You did not find Zigilburk, [placeholder]? No, do not apologize -- I should not have let my hopes rise so. It has surely been many hundreds of years since the axe beheld the heat of these forges.\n\n'Let us return to the Chamber of the Cross-roads and tell my people that the Heart of Fire has been found!'
Bósi has been defeated
There is no sign of Zigilburk by these forges
'Do you hear that? Vile Gredbyg!'
'Well-fought, my friend!'
There is no sign of Zigilburk by these forges
There is no sign of Zigilburk by these forges
Bósi has been defeated
'This is the place, [placeholder]. What do you think?'
You have protected Bósi from the goblins
You and Bósi have come to a neglected corridor in the Western Deeps, hoping to find an entrance to Nâr-khelab, the Heart of Fire.
'Go ahead, [placeholder]: hail, or congratulate, or salute the memory of Ongli!'
Search the forges in the centre
Talk to Bósi
Protect Bósi
Talk to Bósi
Travel with Bósi to the location he has in mind
Talk to Bósi
<rgb=#FF0000>Hail</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>congratulate</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>salute</rgb> the memory of Ongli
Silver runes glow brightly on the wall of the tunnel!
Travel with Bósi into the Heart of Fire
Travel with Bósi into the Heart of Fire
Search the forges on the left
Search the forges on the right
Bósi is in the passage where he believes the doorway to the Heart of Fire may be found.
Bósi is in the passage where he believes the doorway to the Heart of Fire may be found.\n\nBósi is waiting to speak with you about searching for the doorway.
Bósi believes that by hailing or congratulating the memory of the dwarf who built the Heart of Fire, you will gain access to it.
Bósi's guess was correct, and you have found the location of the Heart of Fire.
Bósi's guess was correct, and you have found the location of the Heart of Fire.
Bósi has asked you to investigate the Heart of Fire, looking for Zigilburk, the mithril axe.
'I hope there is more to find here than just gredbyg!'
Bósi is in the Heart of Fire, looking out over the majestic hidden forges.

'What were the secret means of opening it that you recovered from Katûb-zahar, [placeholder]? Ah, yes! The great blacksmith Ongli desired not to be disturbed, even by Durin himself, unless he was greeted with accolades befitting of his station.\n\n'You should <rgb=#FF0000>hail</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>congratulate</rgb> or <rgb=#FF0000>salute</rgb> him, [placeholder]. I hope that we have read the clues aright!'

'The three mighty forges of Nâr-khelab fill me with awe, [placeholder]; I cannot yet bring myself to approach them. Allow me this moment to gaze humbly upon their majesty.\n\n'If you would, please approach each of the three forges and look for the mithril axe Zigilburk. Dare I hope that it might still remain?'
Instance: The Empty Passage
